intro: Zanthoxylum wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan prickly ash, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the Himalayas. It belongs to the Rutaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces bright red berries that are often used in traditional medicine. Its bark and leaves contain various bioactive compounds, making it valuable in phytotherapy. Zanthoxylum wallichianum thrives in temperate and subtropical climates, often found in forested areas at high altitudes.
